title: WhatsApp Chat Gets New Features: Selfie Stickers, Double Tap Reactions And More- Details Here - Zee News
summary:
WhatsApp Rolls Out New Features: Selfie Stickers, Camera Effects and More

Date: January 14, 2025 | Source: Meta Newsroom

WhatsApp is launching an update for 2025 that includes a variety of new features to improve the chat experience and user engagement.

  • Selfie Stickers: Users can now turn selfies into stickers available on Android, with iOS availability coming soon.
  • Camera Effects: 30 new backgrounds, filters, and effects have been added for photos and videos.
  • Quicker Reactions: The double-tap reaction feature allows users to respond more quickly to messages.
  • Share Sticker Pack: Users can share their favorite sticker packs with friends in chats.
New @WhatsApp features, including camera effects, selfie stickers and quicker reactions, make the app more fun and easier to use. — Meta Newsroom (@MetaNewsroom) January 14, 2025

WhatsApp's collaboration with Google aims to combat fake news and promote a safer communication environment.

title: HMPV vs other respiratory viruses: Doctor sheds light on key differences - Hindustan Times
summary:
From influenza to covid-19, here’s how HMPV is different from other respiratory viruses.

Publication Date: Jan 15, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV) has symptoms similar to the flu and cold, can be mild in healthy adults, but severe in children and older adults. Recently, it has garnered attention in India.

  • HMPV was first identified in 2001 and is known to cause respiratory infections, particularly in vulnerable populations.
  • It accounts for 4-16% of acute respiratory infections globally.
  • Unlike COVID-19, HMPV does not have a documented outbreak pattern.
  • Comparatively, influenza is preventable via vaccines, whereas HMPV lacks such preventive measures.
  • HMPV shares transmission methods with SARS-CoV-2 but is less contagious.
“While HMPV and SARS-CoV-2 share a mode of transmission—via respiratory droplets—the latter is much more contagious and has a broader spectrum of symptoms.” - Dr. Maheshkumar Lakhe

In conclusion, understanding the distinctions between HMPV and other respiratory viruses is crucial for public awareness and health management.
newTitle: Key Differences Between HMPV and Other Respiratory Viruses Explained by Doctor

title: Meta apologises for Mark Zuckerberg's Indian elections remarks: ‘Inadvertent error’ - Moneycontrol

Meta India has issued an apology regarding comments made by Mark Zuckerberg about the Indian elections, calling them an “inadvertent error.”

  • Meta's vice president, Shivnath Thukral, acknowledged the mistake in a post.
  • The apology follows remarks by Union minister Ashwini Vaishnaw, who labeled Zuckerberg's comments as “factually incorrect.”
  • India conducted its general elections in 2024, with over 640 million voters participating.
“We would like to apologise for this inadvertent error. India remains an incredibly important country for Meta.” - Shivnath Thukral

Meta's acknowledgment of the error underlines the platform's commitment to accuracy and the significance of India in its operational strategy.

title: Supreme Court stays arrest of ex-IAS trainee Puja Khedkar in UPSC cheating case - Hindustan Times
summary:
Supreme Court Stays Arrest of Former IAS Trainee Puja Khedkar in UPSC Cheating Case

Date: Jan 15, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

The Supreme Court has ordered a stay on the arrest of former IAS officer Puja Khedkar, accused of fraudulently appearing for the UPSC civil service examination in 2022. The court issued a notice to the Delhi Police and the UPSC regarding her plea for anticipatory bail.

  • Puja Khedkar is accused of misrepresenting information to avail reservation benefits in her UPSC application.
  • The Delhi High Court previously rejected her anticipatory bail request, citing a strong prima facie case.
  • The Supreme Court has scheduled a hearing for February 14 and ordered that no coercive action be taken against her in the meantime.
  • Delhi Police assert that a deeper investigation is needed due to emerging conspiracy allegations.
“It's a classic example of fraud, not only with a constitutional body but also with society and the nation as a whole.”

The Supreme Court's intervention provides temporary relief to Khedkar as the legal battle continues around her allegations.
newTitle: Supreme Court Stays Arrest of Former IAS Trainee Puja Khedkar in UPSC Cheating Case

Formula-E case: Supreme Court's shocker to KTR - Greatandhra
summary:
Supreme Court Rejects KTR's Plea in Formula-E Case

Publication Date: January 15, 2023

Source: Great Andhra

The Supreme Court has dealt a significant blow to K T Rama Rao, rejecting his petition to quash the FIR related to the Formula-E car race case. The court upheld the investigation into alleged financial irregularities.

  • The Supreme Court refused to interfere with the ongoing investigation.
  • KTR's legal counsel withdrew the petition seeking to overturn the high court's decision.
  • The case involves claims of financial mismanagement during the Formula-E race in Hyderabad.
  • The Telangana government has filed a caveat, ensuring it can present its arguments before any decisions are made.
“It is not appropriate to quash the case which is still in the investigation stage.” - Mukul Rohatgi, Senior Lawyer

This ruling marks a significant moment in ongoing legal challenges faced by KTR, as he continues to contest the findings related to the Formula-E event.
newTitle: Supreme Court Rejects KTR's Plea in Formula-E Case

title: TikTok prepares for shutdown in US this Sunday. What does it mean? - Hindustan Times
summary:
TikTok prepares for shutdown in US this Sunday. What does it mean?

Date: Jan 15, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

TikTok is set to shut down for US users due to a federal ban take effect. A new law requires TikTok to be sold off from its parent company ByteDance or face a ban.

  • TikTok plans to shut down the app for US users starting this Sunday.
  • The shutdown follows a new law signed by President Biden in April 2024.
  • If the ban is enacted, users may not be able to download the app, though current users can still use it temporarily.
  • TikTok will provide users with a pop-up message directing them to details about the ban.
  • The company is aiming to allow users to download their personal data before shutting down.
  • TikTok claims that one-third of 170 million American users would stop using the app if the ban lasts over a month.
"One-third of the 170 million Americans who use the app would stop doing so if the ban lasts over a month."

This shutdown marks a significant development regarding the regulation of social media platforms in the US, with implications for users and the broader social media landscape.
newTitle: TikTok Prepares for Shutdown in the US this Sunday: Implications and Details

title: How to diagnose obesity: Lancet Commission recommends focussing on fat distribution, not just BMI. Here’s why it is significant - The Indian Express
summary:
Lancet Commission Proposes New Guidelines for Diagnosing Obesity

Publication Date: January 15, 2025 | Source: The Indian Express

The Lancet Diabetes & Endocrinology Commission has introduced a new approach to diagnosing obesity, emphasizing the importance of fat distribution over the traditional BMI method.

  • The commission suggests combining BMI with additional body measurements, such as waist circumference or waist-to-hip ratio.
  • Direct assessments of body fat, such as DEXA scans, are recommended for more accurate diagnoses.
  • Two new categories of obesity have been introduced: clinical obesity and pre-clinical obesity.
  • The focus on abdominal obesity is particularly relevant in India due to high prevalence and health risks associated with it.
  • Current recommendations aim to improve diagnosis, treatment, and understanding of obesity-related health risks.
“Moving beyond BMI-only approaches helps prevent under and over diagnosis of obesity-related health risks.” – Dr. Anoop Misra

This new framework aims to provide personalized treatment strategies that consider individual metabolic profiles and risks.
newTitle: Lancet Commission Proposes New Guidelines for Diagnosing Obesity

title: 'Non-sense, it's treason': Rahul Gandhi slams RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat's ‘true Independence’ statement - Hindustan Times
summary:
Rahul Gandhi Critiques RSS Chief Mohan Bhagwat's Independence Remarks

Date: January 15, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Rahul Gandhi launched a strong attack on RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat for his statement that India's 'true independence' began with the construction of the Ram Mandir in Ayodhya, calling it treason and an insult to Indians.

  • Mohan Bhagwat claimed India attained 'true independence' with the Ram Mandir consecration.
  • Rahul Gandhi condemned Bhagwat's remarks, stating they undermine India's independence movement and the Constitution.
  • The statements have sparked widespread political backlash.
“What he said yesterday is treason because it states that the Constitution is invalid, and the fight against the British was invalid.” - Rahul Gandhi

In conclusion, Gandhi's criticism highlights ongoing political tensions and differing views on India's historical narrative.
newTitle: Rahul Gandhi Critiques RSS Chief Mohan Bhagwat's Independence Remarks

title: Elon Musk’s SpaceX launches two private lunar landers - The Times of India
SpaceX launches two pvt lunar landers towards moon in roundabout journey - Business Standard
summary:
SpaceX Launches Two Private Lunar Landers Towards the Moon

Publication Date: [Date not provided] Source: [Source not provided]

SpaceX successfully launched two lunar landers for US and Japanese companies, marking a significant step in private lunar exploration.

  • SpaceX's launch took place at NASA's Kennedy Space Centre.
  • The landers are taking different routes to the moon, with ispace's lander carrying a rover to gather lunar soil.
  • Firefly Aerospace is conducting NASA experiments, including tools to analyze lunar temperature and protect equipment.
  • ispace's lander, Resilience, will take longer to reach the moon than Firefly's Blue Ghost.
  • NASA's Artemis program aims to return astronauts to the moon by the end of the decade.
"We don't think this is a race... but it's not about the speed," said ispace's CEO Takeshi Hakamada.

Both companies acknowledge the risks involved in reaching the lunar surface, with ongoing advancements in lunar technology crucial for future missions.
newTitle: SpaceX Launches Two Private Lunar Landers Towards the Moon

title: Sonia Gandhi inaugurates Congress’ new Kotla Road headquarters — ‘Indira Bhawan’ - The Hindu

Date: January 15, 2025 Source: The Hindu

The inauguration of the new AICC headquarters, named Indira Bhawan, by Sonia Gandhi marks a significant transition for the Congress party, traditionally based at 24, Akbar Road for nearly five decades.

  • The event included flag hoisting and singing of Vande Matram and the national anthem.
  • The modern facility aims to support the evolving needs of the Congress party.
  • The old headquarters will still be retained for hosting certain party cells.
"It is time for us to move ahead with the times and embrace the new,” said AICC general secretary, organisation, Venugopal.

The Congress party continues to adapt to changing times while honoring its historical roots, aiming for modernization without forgetting the past.

The Congress party has officially inaugurated its new headquarters, Indira Bhawan, at 9A Kotla Road in New Delhi, marking a significant transition after 47 years at its previous location, 24 Akbar Road.

"It is a new beginning. We are very happy that we have a new headquarters. I hope this will bring better things for the party and the country." - Sachin Pilot

The inauguration of Indira Bhawan is seen as a strategic move for the Congress party, aiming to revitalize its operations and outreach as it navigates through challenging political waters.

title: NASA Firefly Blue Ghost Mission 1 Launch to the Moon: When, Where, and How to Watch - Moneycontrol
summary:
NASA Firefly Blue Ghost Mission 1 Launch to the Moon: When, Where, and How to Watch

Date: January 15, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

Firefly Aerospace's Blue Ghost moon lander is set to launch on Wednesday, January 15, bringing NASA’s innovative payloads to the lunar surface.

  • The mission promises insights into Earth's magnetosphere and its interaction with space weather.
  • Launch aboard a SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket at 1:11 a.m. EST (0611 GMT) from NASA’s Kennedy Space Center in Florida.
  • Among the payloads is NASA’s Lunar Environment Heliospheric X-ray Imager (LEXI).
"We expect to see the magnetosphere breathing out and in," said Hyunju Connor, an astrophysicist at NASA’s Goddard Space Flight Center. "It will shrink when the solar wind strengthens and expand when it weakens."

This mission marks a significant step in understanding how solar winds affect Earth's magnetosphere and will provide crucial data for future space weather research.
newTitle: NASA Firefly Blue Ghost Mission 1 Launch to the Moon: When, Where, and How to Watch

title: Weakening rupee puts India interest rate cuts in doubt - Financial Times
summary:
Weakening Rupee Raises Doubts About India's Interest Rate Cuts

Date: January 2024

Source: Financial Times

A drop in the value of India’s rupee has shaken expectations for interest rate cuts by the central bank to stimulate the economy amidst a backdrop of rising inflation and economic slowdown.

  • India's rupee has fallen 0.7% against the dollar, marking its largest one-day drop in nearly two years.
  • The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) was expected to cut the benchmark repo rate from 6.5%, but the falling currency complicates this decision.
  • India's GDP growth fell to 5.4% in the September quarter, its lowest in nearly two years.
  • The RBI has intervened in currency markets, depleting significant foreign reserves to support the rupee.
  • Experts are divided on the implications of the rupee's decline, with some suggesting the RBI has room for maneuver amidst declining inflation.
“It’s not an easy environment for the new governor.” - Trinh Nguyen, economist at Natixis

The ongoing situation poses challenges for India's economic outlook, particularly given its reliance on imports and the necessity for effective monetary policy in response to external pressures.
newTitle: Weakening Rupee Raises Doubts About India's Interest Rate Cuts
